item.title: Systemic Racism in Canada
item.description: 155 years ago, slavery was abolished in the United States. 57 years ago, Martin Luther King Jr delivered his famous “I have a dream” speech and the following year President Lynden B. Johnson abolished segregation within the United States. Today, the barbaric treatment of coloured people, specifically black people, in the United States has seemed to have carried through. With obvious acts of racism within the general population, such as the lynching of Ahmaud Arbery, and systemic racism within the law enforcement and government, such as the murder of George Floyd and multiple statements made by President Donald Trump.
